item.title: British man claims the crown of the world's oldest man at age 111
item.description: British man John Alfred Tinniswood, 111, has been confirmed as the world's oldest man by Guinness World Records.

item.title: Restaurant serves up dishes with a long history
item.description: At Barrio Cafe, eight-time James Beard nominee Silvana Esparza focuses on what she calls ancestral Mexican food. The dishes served in this Phoenix, Arizona eatery are one-of-a-kind - but you'll have to hurry if you want to try them.

item.title: The Uplift: Dapper Wednesdays
item.description: A trendsetting third grader creates a school tradition to don dapper outfits on Wednesdays. A retiree makes it her mission to thank those who may be in thankless jobs. Plus, more heartwarming and inspiring stories.

item.title: Israel finds body of a hostage killed in Gaza; cease-fire talks to resume
item.description: The discovery renewed pressure on Israel's government for a deal to get the remaining hostages freed.

item.title: Ronda Rousey, professional wrestler and actor, shares story of defeat and triumph in new memoir
item.description: Ronda Rousey launched UFC's women's division in 2012 and wowed audiences for years before she suffered her first loss in 2015 and retired in 2016. After taking some time off the grid, Rousey is back with a new memoir. Dana Jacobson has more.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Phosphorescent performs "Wide As Heaven"
item.description: Alabama native Matthew Houck began performing under his stage name Phosphorescent in 2001, and soon developed a devoted following with his folk-influenced indie classics. After a six-year wait, the acclaimed musician is out with his eighth studio album "Revelator." Now making a long-awaited return to Saturday Sessions, here is Phosphorescent with "Wide As Heaven."

item.title: Evidence presented at Michelle Troconis' murder conspiracy trial
item.description: Michelle Troconis was convicted of helping her boyfriend Fotis Dulos murder his estranged wife. Prosecutors say she helped plan the murder, destroy evidence and create an alibi for Dulos.

item.title: Powerball prize climbs to $1.3 billion ahead of Saturday's drawing
item.description: Saturday's jackpot will be Powerball's fourth biggest ever and the eighth largest in U.S. lottery history.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Phosphorescent performs "The World Is Ending"
item.description: Alabama native Matthew Houck began performing under his stage name Phosphorescent in 2001, and soon developed a devoted following with his folk-influenced indie classics. After a six-year wait, the acclaimed musician is out with his eighth studio album "Revelator." Now making a long-awaited return to Saturday Sessions, here is Phosphorescent with "The World Is Ending."

item.title: Mexico's president says country will break diplomatic ties with Ecuador
item.description: Police broke into the Mexican Embassy to arrest a former vice president who had sought political asylum there after being indicted on corruption charges.

item.title: Are your eclipse glasses safe? How to tell before the total solar eclipse.
item.description: The 2024 total solar eclipse is approaching. Here's how to check your solar glasses and tell if they're safe to use.

item.title: Book excerpt: "Grown Woman Talk" about menopause
item.description: In her new book Dr. Sharon Malone, an OB/GYN and certified menopause practitioner, addresses issues facing women who may feel marginalized about their health questions as they get older.

item.title: Eye on America: Honoring suffragists and other women’s achievements
item.description: In Arizona, we learn why flag football is becoming an increasingly popular sport, especially among girls. Then in New York, we meet with descendants of some of the most notable suffragists of the 20th century. Watch these stories and more on "Eye on America" with host Michelle Miller.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Phosphorescent performs "Revelator"
item.description: Alabama native Matthew Houck began performing under his stage name Phosphorescent in 2001, and soon developed a devoted following with his folk-influenced indie classics. After a six-year wait, the acclaimed musician is out with his eighth studio album "Revelator." Now making a long-awaited return to Saturday Sessions, here is Phosphorescent with "Revelator."

item.title: Eye Opener: Earthquake rattles Northeast region
item.description: A New Jersey earthquake was felt in at least 14 states Friday. Meanwhile, President Joe Biden took an aerial tour of the ruins of the Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, and vowed that he had the community’s back as the work to rebuild continues. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.

item.title: First HBCU team to win national championship finally get their White House moment
item.description: Members of the Tennessee A&I Tigers’ 1957 championship-winning team finally visited the White House this week to celebrate their victory.

item.title: Doctor travels to Gaza to treat children injured in Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Emergency physician Dr. Mohammad Subeh spent five weeks in Gaza, sometimes donating his own blood to treat young victims.

item.title: Decades after their service, "Rosie the Riveters" to be honored
item.description: Of the millions of women who performed exceptional service, just dozens have survived long enough to see their work recognized.

item.title: After more than 60 years, a championship team gets its White House moment
item.description: The Tennessee A&I Tigers were the first HBCU team to win a national championship in 1957.

item.title: 2 dead, 7 injured after fight turns into officer-involved shooting at Miami-Dade shopping center
item.description: This is a developing news story. Tune into CBS News Miami on-air and online for the latest updates.

item.title: Eclipse seekers in Texas may get clouds, but New England looks clear
item.description: Meteorologists now feel increasingly confident in models that show some parts of the country looking golden for the eclipse on Monday, April 8. Other parts of the country, though, may end up in a cloudy bust.

item.title: How to watch WrestleMania 40: Livestream options, schedule, more
item.description: Here's how to watch Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson and all the matches at WrestleMania 40 today.

item.title: Biden campaign says he raised over $90 million in March
item.description: President Biden's total exceeds Obama's total in March 2012.

item.title: Fashion designer finds rewarding career as private chef
item.description: Katya Ekimian, 25, a former fashion designer has found a satisfying career as a private chef: "It's creative, it's manual, it's artistic."

item.title: Russian missile strikes on Ukrainian city of Kharkiv leaves at least 6 dead
item.description: Governor of the Kharkiv region Oleh Syniehubov said missile strikes on the city damaged residential buildings, a kindergarten and cars.

item.title: Soyuz brings U.S. astronaut, 2 station crewmates, back to Earth
item.description: Landing on the steppe of Kazakhstan completed the replacement of five long-duration space station fliers.

item.title: How to watch today's Alabama vs. UConn men's NCAA March Madness Final Four basketball game: Livestream options, more
item.description: Track the men's Final Four schedule as the Alabama Crimson Tide try to stay in the game against the UConn Huskies.

item.title: How to watch the men's Final Four NCAA March Madness games today
item.description: Two teams will move on to the national championship game, but first the Final Four. Here's how and when to watch.

item.title: DJ Burns Jr. vs. Zach Edey: How to watch today's NC State vs. Purdue men's March Madness Final Four basketball game
item.description: The upstart NC State Wolfpack takes on the Purdue Boilermakers in the men's March Madness Final Four game today.

item.title: The best Mother's Day gifts under $100 will delight every kind of mom
item.description: Show Mom how much you care with one of these gifts, all handpicked for mothers of all stripes and less than $100.
